noun.description: A person filled with excessive and single-minded zeal, especially for an extreme religious or political cause.

adjective.description: Filled with or expressing excessive zeal.

origin: Mid 16th century (as an adjective): from French fanatique or Latin fanaticus of a temple, inspired by a god, from fanum temple. The adjective originally described behavior that might result from possession by a god or demon, hence the earliest sense of the noun a religious maniac (mid 17th century).
